subject: Personal Finance
title: Mortgages Explained
description: A short lesson to help you apply Mortgages Explained.

hook.text: The word 'mortgage' comes from French for 'death pledge.' The debt lasts until it dies â€” or you do.

buildup.text: A mortgage is a loan to buy property, typically repaid over 15 to 30 years.

discovery.text: In the early years, most of your payment goes to interest. The principal barely moves.

twist.text: A 30-year mortgage at 7% means you pay more in interest than the original house price.

climax.text: Despite the cost, mortgages let ordinary people build wealth through property they couldn't buy outright.

punchline.text: The 'death pledge' built the middle class.

quiz.question: What does the word 'mortgage' literally mean?
